info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 12:20PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Warren, south central Rock Island, eastern Mercer and southwestern Henry Counties through 1245 PM CDT... At 1220 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burgess, or near Aledo, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Burgess, Orion, Viola, Woodhull, Matherville, Alpha, Sherrard, Andover, North Henderson, Cable, Shale City, New Windsor, Lynn Center, Boden, Preemption, Alexis, Ophiem, Wanlock, Swedona and Gilchrist. This includes Interstate 74 in Illinois between mile markers 19 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
